top_categories.workout_context: Walburg Dirty 30’s texas hill country gravel - rolling hills, limestone roads, ranch land, technical sections demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Walburg Dirty 30 isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.

Walburg Dirty 30’s texas hill country gravel - rolling hills, limestone roads, ranch land, technical sections and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Walburg Dirty 30 — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Walburg Dirty 30 rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.

Walburg Dirty 30’s texas hill country gravel - rolling hills, limestone roads, ranch land, technical sections drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Walburg Dirty 30 when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.

Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Walburg Dirty 30 — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on texas hill country gravel - rolling hills, limestone roads, ranch land, technical sections.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Walburg Dirty 30. Make this intensity feel like home.
The varied gradients at Walburg Dirty 30 reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Walburg Dirty 30 count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.

Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Walburg Dirty 30’s texas hill country gravel - rolling hills, limestone roads, ranch land, technical sections delivers on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Standard hydration and fueling. One bottle per hour minimum. Gel or bar every 45 minutes at race intensity.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Walburg Dirty 30 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on texas hill country gravel - rolling hills, limestone roads, ranch land, technical sections to build confidence.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 30 miles of texas hill country gravel - rolling hills, limestone roads, ranch land, technical sections in Walburg, Texas.
